The results of the experiment have been validated through multiple replications and independent verification, providing robust support for the proposed theory.

eng-30-00230475-n_miscarriage: A natural loss of the products of conception.
Una pérdida natural de los productos de la concepción.
The woman experienced a miscarriage at six weeks into her pregnancy.
La mujer sufrió un aborto espontáneo a las seis semanas de embarazo.
The doctor confirmed that the patient had suffered a miscarriage due to complications with the placenta.
El médico confirmó que la paciente había sufrido un aborto espontáneo debido a complicaciones en el placenta.
The couple was devastated by their second miscarriage, which occurred after a routine ultrasound revealed no fetal heartbeat.
El matrimonio se desmoronó al tener su segundo embarazo abortado, que ocurrió después de una ecografía rutinaria que reveló la ausencia de latido fetal.
The statistics show that approximately 15% of all pregnancies result in a miscarriage.
Las estadísticas muestran que alrededor del 15% de todas las embarazos terminan en un aborto espontáneo.
The emotional and physical toll of multiple miscarriages can be overwhelming for many couples.
El impacto emocional y físico de varios embarazos que terminan en aborto espontáneo puede ser excesivamente agotador para muchas parejas.

eng-30-00639556-n_experiment: The act of conducting a controlled test or investigation.
La acción de realizar una prueba o investigación controlada.

The purpose of the experiment was to determine whether exposure to certain chemicals would have any impact on human behavior.

The results of the experiment were surprising, as they showed that a previously unknown species of fish had been discovered in the deep sea.

The experiment involved exposing rats to different levels of noise and measuring their stress responses.
La investigación implicó expuesto a los ratones a diferentes niveles de ruido y medir sus respuestas al estrés.
The experiment was designed to test the hypothesis that exposure to certain environmental factors would increase the risk of developing cancer.
